flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: If you are into making electronic equipment like synthesizers, ham equipment, amplifiers, etc you often need to make a front panel. Many times in DIY work front panels are scrawled in Sharpie (been there). This method results in a very attractive front panel that is readable and durable. I recommend this method for "one-offs" and prototypes. It would be a bit labor intensive for production work.
guide.introduction_rendered: If you are into making electronic equipment like synthesizers, ham equipment, amplifiers, etc you often need to make a front panel. Many times in DIY work front panels are scrawled in Sharpie (been there). This method results in a very attractive front panel that is readable and durable. I recommend this method for "one-offs" and prototypes. It would be a bit labor intensive for production work.
guide.summary: Ray Wilson of MFOS describes a method of making panels for electronic devices specifically synthesizers, but the method could be used for bench equipment, amplifiers, etc.
guide.title: How To Make Synth-DIY Front Panels
